en-ZZ: Read the information below.
<b>Book Survey</b><br />

Amundsen wanted victory at the South Pole. On 14 January 1911, he disembarked in the Antarctic, in the Bay of Whales. He prepared to spend the winter with eight companions and 116 dogs at Framheim, a base built on the Ross Barrier. On 20 October 1911, Amundsen and four of his men set out from Framheim to conquer the South Pole with twelve dogs per sledge. On 17 November, at around 85° South, they reached the foot of a chain of mountains, the Transantarctic Chain, and would now have to find a way across. They then began a terrifying climb up a glacier, the Axel Heiberg, full of crevasses.
sr-RS: Amundsen je želeo pobedu na Južnom polu. Četrnaestog januara 1911. on se iskrcao na Antarktiku u Zalivu kitova. Spremio se da provede zimu sa osmoro saputnika i 116 pasa u Framhajmu, bazi sagrađenoj na Rosovoj barijeri. Dvadesetog oktobra 1911, Amundsen i četvorica njegovih ljudi krenuli su iz Framhajma da osvoje Južni pol i poveli po dvanaest pasa za svake saonice. Sedamnaestog novembra, na oko 85° južne geografske širine, stigli su do podnožja Transantarktičkog planinskog venca i sada je trebalo da nađu put preko njega. Počeli su zastrašujući uspon uz glečer Aksel Hajberg koji je pun pukotina.
